required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: OrthoIllustrated Web Based Orthopaedic Sports Medicine Registry
clinical_study.official_title: Orthopaedic Sports Medicine, Arthroscopy, and Related Surgery Registry Using the Web-based OrthoIllustrated Surgical Outcome System

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to establish an international, web based clinical registry to collect baseline characteristics of patients undergoing orthopaedic, sports medicine, arthroscopy, and related surgery, and the subsequent outcomes and cost-effectiveness associated with the surgical procedures and nonoperative treatments.

clinical_study.condition: Degenerative and Traumatic Pathology of the Knee
Degenerative and Traumatic Pathology of the Shoulder and Elbow
Degenerative and Traumatic Pathology of the Foot and Ankle
Degenerative and Traumatic Pathology of the Hand and Wrist
Degenerative and Traumatic Pathology of the Hip

arm_group.description: All eligible patients receiving orthopedic, sports medicine, arthroscopy and related surgery or nonoperative treatment

study_pop.textblock: Cohort will be selected from clinic patients scheduling surgery or nonoperative treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients electing to schedule routine and medically indicated orthopedic, sports medicine, arthroscopy and related surgery or nonoperative treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Non English or Spanish speaking
- vulnerable populations, excluding minors

facility.name: Santa Monica Orthopedics and Sports Medicine Group
Coastal Orthopedics and Pain Management and Sports Medicine
National Training Center, Sports Medicine Institute
The Orthopedic Center of St. Louis
Beacon Orthopaedics and Sports Medicine LTD
Oregon Orthopedic & Sports Medicine Clinic, LLP
Texas Institute for Hip & Knee Surgery
The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston
Centre for Sports Medicine and Orthopaedics

reference.citation: Gliklich RE, Dreyer NA, eds. Registries for Evaluating Patient Outcomes: A User's Guide. AHRQ Publication No. 07-EHC001-1. Rockville, MD: Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality. April 2007.

Schemitsch EH, Bhandari M, Boden SD, Bourne RB, Bozic KJ, Jacobs JJ, Zdero R. The evidence-based approach in bringing new orthopaedic devices to market. J Bone Joint Surg Am. 2010 Apr;92(4):1030-7. doi: 10.2106/JBJS.H.01532. Review.
Capozzi JD, Rhodes R. Examining the ethical implications of an orthopaedic joint registry. J Bone Joint Surg Am. 2010 May;92(5):1330-3. doi: 10.2106/JBJS.I.01410.
